1. Encuentre los valores para $x$ y $y$.

  (a) $$(3,1) + (x,y) = (2,3)$$
  (b) $$(a,1) + (x,y) = (-3,b)$$
  (c) $$(a,b) + (x,y) = (c,d)$$
  (d) $$(x,y) + (a,b) = (0,0)$$
  
2. Si $\textnf{P} = (2,-1)$$, $$\textbf{Q} = (-3,2)$$, $$\lambda = 2$$ y $$\mu = -1$$, compruébese que

  (a) $$\lambda(\textbf{P} + \textbf{Q}) = \lambda\textbf{P} + \lambda\textbf{Q}$$
  (b) $$(\lambda + \mu)\textbf{P} = \lambda\textbf{P} + \lambda\textbf{Q}$$
  (c) $$(\lambda\mu)\textbf{P} = \lambda(\mu\textbf{P})$$
  
3. Si $A = \Bigg( \begin{matrix} 1 & 3 & 2 \\ 1 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \end{matrix}\Bigg)$, $B = \Bigg( \begin{matrix} -1 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 \\ 1 & 1 & -1 \end{matrix}\Bigg)$ y $C = \Bigg( \begin{matrix} 1 & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 \end{matrix}\Bigg)$

  (a) Compruebe las leyes distributivas y asociativas.
  (b) Si $\textbf{x} = [1,2,3]^T$, calcule $\textbf{Ax}$
  (c) Compruebe que $Tr(\textbf{ABC}) = Tr(\textbf{CAB})$
  
4. Si $\textbf{b}_1 = (1,0,0,0)$, $\textbf{b}_2$, $\textbf{b}_3 = (1,1,1,0)$, $\textbf{b}_4 = (1,1,1,1)$ y $\textbf{x} = a_1\textbf{b}_1 + a_2\textbf{b}_2 + a_3\textbf{b}_3 + a_4\textbf{b}_4$, calculelas coordenadas de $\textbf{x}$
